ArticleTitle.sentence: Signalling via CD28 of human naive neonatal T lymphocytes.

event.clue: Signalling via CD28 of human naive neonatal T lymphocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: Accessory molecules play a crucial role in the development of the T cell response to antigenic challenge.

AbstractText.sentence: To compare the role of CD28, neonatal and adult T cells were stimulated with a pair of mitogenic anti-CD2 antibodies in the presence or absence of anti-CD28 MoAb.

AbstractText.sentence: With anti-CD2 alone, neonatal T cells proliferated slightly but produced no detectable IL-2, whereas adult T cells proliferated vigorously, with significant IL-2 production.

AbstractText.sentence: Costimulation with anti-CD28 MoAb greatly enhanced the proliferative response of neonatal T cells to levels equivalent to those of adult T cells, whereas adult T cells showed only slight increases.

AbstractText.sentence: Although IL-2 secretion was increased in the presence of anti-CD28 MoAb, neonatal T cell IL-2 production remained lower than in adults.

AbstractText.sentence: The cellular mechanism governing the diminished proliferative response of neonatal T lymphocytes to anti-CD2 may therefore be due to decreased NF kappa B induction, reduced IL-2 mRNA expression and deficient IL-2 production.
